segment.source: Account Policies (Windows 10)
segment.target: Account Policies (Windows 10)

segment.source: An overview of account policies in Windows and provides links to policy descriptions.
segment.target: An overview of account policies in Windows and provides links to policy descriptions.

segment.source: Account Policies
segment.target: Account Policies

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: An overview of account policies in Windows and provides links to policy descriptions.
segment.target: An overview of account policies in Windows and provides links to policy descriptions.

segment.source: All account policies settings applied by using Group Policy are applied at the domain level.
segment.target: All account policies settings applied by using Group Policy are applied at the domain level.

segment.source: Default values are present in the built-in default domain controller policy for Password Policy settings, Account Lockout Policy settings, and Kerberos Policy settings.
segment.target: Default values are present in the built-in default domain controller policy for Password Policy settings, Account Lockout Policy settings, and Kerberos Policy settings.

segment.source: The domain account policy becomes the default local account policy of any device that is a member of the domain.
segment.target: The domain account policy becomes the default local account policy of any device that is a member of the domain.

segment.source: If these policies are set at any level below the domain level in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS), they affect only local accounts on member servers.
segment.target: If these policies are set at any level below the domain level in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS), they affect only local accounts on member servers.

segment.source: Note: Each domain can have only one account policy.
segment.target: Note: Each domain can have only one account policy.

segment.source: The account policy must be defined in the default domain policy or in a new policy that is linked to the root of the domain and given precedence over the default domain policy, which is enforced by the domain controllers in the domain.
segment.target: The account policy must be defined in the default domain policy or in a new policy that is linked to the root of the domain and given precedence over the default domain policy, which is enforced by the domain controllers in the domain.

segment.source: These domain-wide account policy settings (Password Policy, Account Lockout Policy, and Kerberos Policy) are enforced by the domain controllers in the domain; therefore, domain controllers always retrieve the values of these account policy settings from the default domain policy Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: These domain-wide account policy settings (Password Policy, Account Lockout Policy, and Kerberos Policy) are enforced by the domain controllers in the domain; therefore, domain controllers always retrieve the values of these account policy settings from the default domain policy Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: The only exception is when another account policy is defined for an organizational unit (OU).
segment.target: The only exception is when another account policy is defined for an organizational unit (OU).

segment.source: The account policy settings for the OU affect the local policy on any computers that are contained in the OU.
segment.target: The account policy settings for the OU affect the local policy on any computers that are contained in the OU.

segment.source: For example, if an OU policy defines a maximum password age that differs from the domain-level account policy, the OU policy will be applied and enforced only when users log on to the local computer.
segment.target: For example, if an OU policy defines a maximum password age that differs from the domain-level account policy, the OU policy will be applied and enforced only when users log on to the local computer.

segment.source: The default local computer policies apply only to computers that are in a workgroup or in a domain where neither an OU account policy nor a domain policy applies.
segment.target: The default local computer policies apply only to computers that are in a workgroup or in a domain where neither an OU account policy nor a domain policy applies.
